content.description: See photo. Sit start with left hand on low side pull jug and right hand on good sloper. Make a few moves on good holds to a rest before the crux. Once at the lip, traverse right on small crimps. Make your way up the arete bulge using small holds. Continue around the arete onto easy slab top out. This problem goes for shorter people and taller.
content.location: This problem starts directly to the right of Curare if you're facing the boulder. The crux can be scary overcoming the bulge, there is a boulder behind and underneath you as you move through this section. If you were to fall with no protection or good spotter, it would be possible to hit your head on this boulder. Nothing a pad and spotter can't fix.

content.description: Curare Roof hosts two awesome committing problems on great rock and Juggy holds that lead into heady Topouts.The most obvious direct line is the low start CURARE from a pair of Incuts under the boulder, up a selection of jugs to a paralyzing headwall and the perfect sit start with the lower but gnarly exit to the right side of the roof is called Livin Like Larry which uses the sparse crimps, slimps, and slopers to turn an improbable face into a well earned send! LLL starts on chest high left box and right sloper from the sit start. There is a left line potential that starts in a boxy corner and could go up along the crimps and sloper Arete but it has not been worked yet.
